skill.name: ghe-report
skill.description:
Generate DETAILED reports with metrics, health checks, or epic-specific analysis. More comprehensive than quick status overview.

USE THIS SKILL WHEN:
- User asks for "metrics" or "statistics" or "performance report"
- User asks for "health check" or "workflow health" or "compliance check"
- User asks for "epic report" or "epic status for X"
- User asks for "detailed report" or "comprehensive report"
- User asks "how are we performing" or "what's our throughput"
- User asks about "cycle times" or "demotion rates"
- User wants analysis, not just current state

REPORT TYPES:
- metrics: Throughput, cycle times, first-pass rates, demotion rates
- health: Compliance status, stale threads, violation history, memory bank status
- epic: Single epic details with thread history, progress, decisions

DO NOT USE THIS SKILL WHEN:
- User just wants QUICK status overview (use ghe-status)
- User wants to CLAIM an issue (use ghe-claim)
- User wants to POST a checkpoint (use ghe-checkpoint)
- User wants to TRANSITION phases (use ghe-transition)

KEY DIFFERENCE FROM ghe-status:
- ghe-status = quick overview, current state, what's active
- ghe-report = detailed analysis, metrics, trends, health assessment

EXAMPLES:
<example>
Context: User wants performance metrics
user: "Show me the workflow metrics"
assistant: "I'll use ghe-report with type 'metrics' for detailed performance analysis"
</example>
<example>
Context: User wants to check workflow compliance
user: "Run a health check on the workflow"
assistant: "I'll use ghe-report with type 'health' to assess workflow compliance"
</example>
<example>
Context: User wants details on specific epic
user: "Give me a report on the jwt-auth epic"
assistant: "I'll use ghe-report with type 'epic' for jwt-auth"
</example>
<example>
Context: User asks about performance trends
user: "What's our first-pass review rate?"
assistant: "I'll use ghe-report with type 'metrics' to get performance statistics"
</example>
skill.summary: Generate DETAILED reports with metrics, health checks, or epic-specific analysis. More comprehensive...
skill.author: Emasoft

security_audit.summary: This is a pure prompt-based skill with no executable code. It defines report generation behavior and output formats for the GHE workflow system. No scripts, network calls, filesystem access beyond specified directories, or external commands are present.

content.value_statement: Get comprehensive metrics, health assessments, and epic analysis for your GitHub Elements workflow. This skill provides deeper insights than quick status overviews, including performance trends, compliance status, and technical decisions.
actual_capabilities: Generate metrics reports with throughput, cycle times, and first-pass rates
Create health reports with compliance status, stale thread detection, and violation history
Produce epic reports with thread history, progress tracking, and remaining work estimates
Post reports to both GitHub Issue Threads and local GHE_REPORTS directory
Respect ghe.local.md settings for detail level and notification preferences
limitations: Does not modify workflow state or transition phases
Cannot execute code or interact with external systems
Limited to report generation based on existing GitHub data

use_cases.title: Track team performance
use_cases.description: Monitor throughput, cycle times, and quality metrics across development phases

use_cases.title: Assess workflow health
use_cases.description: Identify stale threads, compliance violations, and memory bank synchronization issues

use_cases.title: Review epic progress
use_cases.description: Get detailed status updates on specific epics including decisions and remaining work

prompt_templates.title: Quick metrics overview
prompt_templates.prompt: Show me the workflow metrics including throughput and cycle times

prompt_templates.title: Health assessment
prompt_templates.prompt: Run a health check on our workflow compliance and identify any stale threads

prompt_templates.title: Epic deep dive
prompt_templates.prompt: Give me a detailed report on the jwt-auth epic including thread history and remaining work

prompt_templates.title: Quality analysis
prompt_templates.prompt: What's our first-pass review rate and demotion rate for the past month

output: ### Throughput: 12 features completed (+3 vs last week), 8 bugs fixed (-2 vs last week)
### Cycle Times: DEV (4.2 sessions avg), TEST (2.1 sessions avg), REVIEW (3.5 sessions avg)
### Quality: First-pass REVIEW rate: 68%, Demotion rate: 12%

best_practices: Use ghe-report for analysis needs, ghe-status for quick overviews
Specify report type (metrics, health, or epic) for focused results
Post reports to both GitHub Issues and GHE_REPORTS for persistence
anti_patterns: Using ghe-report for quick status checks instead of ghe-status
Requesting phase transitions or issue claiming in report prompts
Expecting real-time data updates from report generation

faq.question: What report types are available?
faq.answer: Three types: metrics (performance), health (compliance), and epic (specific project details).

faq.question: How is ghe-report different from ghe-status?
faq.answer: ghe-status provides quick current-state overviews. ghe-report delivers detailed analysis with trends and metrics.

faq.question: Where are reports stored?
faq.answer: Reports post to both the GitHub Issue Thread and the local GHE_REPORTS directory with timestamped filenames.

faq.question: Is my data safe with this skill?
faq.answer: Yes. This skill is read-only for GitHub data and only writes generated reports to designated locations.

faq.question: Can I customize report detail level?
faq.answer: Yes. Settings in .claude/ghe.local.md control notification_level and stale_threshold_hours.

faq.question: What AI tools support this skill?
faq.answer: Works with Claude, Codex, and Claude Code through the standard skill invocation mechanism.
